commit_message:
Fix node creates the specified cluster error

When a node is created to specify a cluster, the cluster node has
reached its maximum，the node state is always in its INIT state.

Change-Id: I5c3aebf606b00655b6a5a515bd368395f26a8965
Closes-Bug: 1746913

commit_message:
Make shell script graceful

When $READY is None, it will raise an ungraceful error called
"== unary operator expected".

Change-Id: I7e263ca2073d0b35134c2e84669066a98415ce04

commit_message:
[placement] Add sending global request ID in put (2)

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header
in the request of PUT in SchedulerReportClient.
When claiming resources, the header is added.

Subsequent patches will add the header in the other cases.

Change-Id: I73d5aceed399ae906ee577e91c80551284faf21e
Partial-Bug: #1734625

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-02 05:58:50.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hpe/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': '3PAR: fix cloning issue in create group from source.

When group or group snapshot is created from two
different volume types having provisioning set
one volume type and compression set on other
volume type and then if we create group from
existing group or group snapshot then we are
making use of source snapshot and online copy
feature of 3par for copying data from source
to destination.

But we have not kept mapping of source volume and
its snapshot and because of this, from any snapshot
of data gets copied to any destination volume and
created issues mentioned in bug.

This patch creates mapping of source volume and its
Snapshot, so correct snapshot get selected for correct
destination volume for copying of data.

Change-Id: I435cd47908fefaa767063fa4c61f3a4d76ffc4ae
Closes-Bug: #1744025
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR: fix cloning issue in create group from source.

When group or group snapshot is created from two
different volume types having provisioning set
one volume type and compression set on other
volume type and then if we create group from
existing group or group snapshot then we are
making use of source snapshot and online copy
feature of 3par for copying data from source
to destination.

But we have not kept mapping of source volume and
its snapshot and because of this, from any snapshot
of data gets copied to any destination volume and
created issues mentioned in bug.

This patch creates mapping of source volume and its
Snapshot, so correct snapshot get selected for correct
destination volume for copying of data.

Change-Id: I435cd47908fefaa767063fa4c61f3a4d76ffc4ae
Closes-Bug: #1744025

Fix DuplicateOptError in fixed_key migration code

it handles DuplicateOptError.

commit_message:
Update document for worker cleanup API

Update API document for API 'workers/cleanup',
also remove 'until' from allowed clean keys as
its value is always assigned in code.

Change-Id: Iea940d7c7e52718b8e5e8dcf706aa5d1126860ef

commit_message:
Fix link in boot from volume docs

The links to the user guide haven't worked since the docs migration
in pike. This updates the link to point at the docs which are now
in nova, and removes the useless link to the end user guide since
the content doesn't live there anymore.

Depends-On: Ie039322660fd0e2e0403843448379b78114c425b

Change-Id: I3e79e14ef9c50c1f43d334ecae1c9810bf601418
Closes-Bug: #1711267

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-31 21:47:21.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/image/test_image_uploader.py', 'tripleo_common/image/image_uploader.py'], 'message': "Tolerate missing labels for prepare --tag-from-label

The upstream ceph image[1] doesn't do fine-grained versioned tags, and
doesn't have any labels which match to tags. This means that doing a
--tag-from-label on every image during prepare fails when it gets to
the ceph image.

This change extracts the provided tag for each image and returns that
tag if there is no label to do the discovery with.

[1] https://hub.docker.com/r/ceph/daemon/

Change-Id: I9e3d154a7702120d1a82e39c1d08e22eb8e4587f
Closes-Bug: 1746600
"}]
commit_message:
Tolerate missing labels for prepare --tag-from-label

The upstream ceph image[1] doesn't do fine-grained versioned tags, and
doesn't have any labels which match to tags. This means that doing a
--tag-from-label on every image during prepare fails when it gets to
the ceph image.

This change extracts the provided tag for each image and returns that
tag if there is no label to do the discovery with.

[1] https://hub.docker.com/r/ceph/daemon/

Change-Id: I9e3d154a7702120d1a82e39c1d08e22eb8e4587f
Closes-Bug: 1746600

subject: Add scope_types to role policies
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-05 21:46:05.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/policies/role.py'], 'message': "Add scope_types to role policies

This commit sets the scope types for role policies to `system`. When
keystone supports full role management without having to modify
service policy files we should consider adding `project` to the
list of scope types.

From now on, a warning will be logged when a project-scoped token is
used to manage roles. Operators can opt into requiring system-scoped
tokens for these policies by enabling oslo.policy's `enable_scope`
configuration option, which will result in an HTTP Forbidden
exception when mismatching scope is detected.

Change-Id: I7eb7aef7dbf99a86feacb9346090a02a7bd97e7c
"}]
commit_message:
Add scope_types to role policies

This commit sets the scope types for role policies to `system`. When
keystone supports full role management without having to modify
service policy files we should consider adding `project` to the
list of scope types.

From now on, a warning will be logged when a project-scoped token is
used to manage roles. Operators can opt into requiring system-scoped
tokens for these policies by enabling oslo.policy's `enable_scope`
configuration option, which will result in an HTTP Forbidden
exception when mismatching scope is detected.

Change-Id: I7eb7aef7dbf99a86feacb9346090a02a7bd97e7c

Tacker does not have tempest plugin so it does
not need to have service register in tempest.

This commit removes the commented TEMPEST_SERVICES
setting to avoid any confusion.

Change-Id: I7ea859ce373e5118ebf38bc1adcb6b6fec97f785
Related-Bug: #1743688
'}]
commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

Tacker does not have tempest plugin so it does
not need to have service register in tempest.

This commit removes the commented TEMPEST_SERVICES
setting to avoid any confusion.

Change-Id: I7ea859ce373e5118ebf38bc1adcb6b6fec97f785
Related-Bug: #1743688

commit_message:
Fix the share can't create in manila_tempest_tests

Default default_share_type is <None> in manila.conf,when
some tests in manila_tempest_tests are executed,share build ERROR,
The reason for these failures is share type can't find.
This patch adds share_type_id configuration in
some manila_tempest_tests to repair these failures.

Change-Id: I3f1be73caebd06c7a072e9c9c3e0df56b368e6c7

commit_message:
Fix wrong link for "Manage Flavors" in CPU topologies doc

The last sentence here where it links to "Manage Flavors"
is the wrong link. It goes here:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/flavors.html which
doesn't talk about NUMA extra specs. It should be pointing at
the "NUMA topology" section of the flavor extra specs page:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/flavors.html#extra-specs-numa-topology

Change-Id: I30f6bc70afc5be00737cdf76e0e47bcb898a3a7f
Closes-Bug: #1747562

commit_message:
Use nova os-services to retrieve host list

novaclient version 10 has dropped the support for novaclient.v2.hosts.
os-aggregates and migrateLive APIs expects host from os-services,
so this commit retrieves host list from os-services API.

Change-Id: I5ec007ab1f244ca8caee1eb7b5d4262ac6c32171
Closes-Bug: #1745502

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 6763, 'name': 'jingliuqing', 'email': 'jing.liuqing@99cloud.net', 'username': 'jing'}, {'_account_id': 8478, 'name': 'Vladislav Kuzmin', 'email': 'vkuzmin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vkuzmin'}, {'_account_id': 8648, 'name': 'Radomir Dopieralski', 'email': 'openstack@dopieralski.pl', 'username': 'thesheep'}, {'_account_id': 11885, 'name': 'Ying Zuo', 'email': 'yingzuo4@gmail.com', 'username': 'yingzuo'}, {'_account_id': 14151, 'name': 'ziyu032', 'email': 'chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net', 'username': 'ziyu032'}, {'_account_id': 19930, 'name': 'Dai Dang Van', 'email': 'daikk115@gmail.com', 'username': 'daidv'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24056, 'name': 'wei.ying', 'email': 'wei.ying@easystack.cn', 'username': 'wei.ying'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-02-04 20:58:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/conf/nova_policy.json', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/api_access/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance.module.js', 'openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/rest/test_policy.py', 'doc/source/configuration/settings.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/conf/nova_policy.d/api-extensions.yaml', 'openstack_dashboard/settings.py'], 'message': 'Sync nova policy

Based on nova commit 32c8ac6b7dfe4ca0c211cbce7c5a67d88558126f

The new file was generated by oslopolicy-sample-generator:
  oslopolicy-sample-generator --namespace nova --format json

nova uses policy-in-code now, so there is a lot of differences.
Sorted version diff is http://paste.openstack.org/show/628742/

All policies with "@" have been dropped.
Dropped policies used in horizon are:
  os_compute_api:os-certificates:create
  os_compute_api:os-scheduler-hints:discoverable
  os_compute_api:os-server-groups:discoverable

[discoverable]
"discoverable" policies are related to nova API extensions
but the API extension mechanism has gone in Nova Queens,
so these policies now make no sense in Nova.
In Horizon side, we are still use a bit older API version
to launch instance, so it seems some fallback policies are needed
and they are added as conf/nova_policy.d.

[os_compute_api:os-certificates:create]
No corresponding policy is found, so the related policy check is dropped.
EC2 API is provided as a separate project from nova.
I guess this is the reason the policy was dropped.
DownloadEC2 action referred to it, but we already checks EC2 service
is available so I believe the policy can be dropped safely.

[openstack_dashboard.test.unit.api.rest.test_policy]
Unit tests are updated according to the nova policy change.
Note that test_rule_alone previously succeeded because it used
non-existing policy and fallbacked to 'default' rule.
The rule is changed to a policy for non-admin user.

Change-Id: I68f91bc29b20a4ecd613fc75735d38b9a48162ee
'}]
commit_message:
Sync nova policy

Based on nova commit 32c8ac6b7dfe4ca0c211cbce7c5a67d88558126f

The new file was generated by oslopolicy-sample-generator:
  oslopolicy-sample-generator --namespace nova --format json

nova uses policy-in-code now, so there is a lot of differences.
Sorted version diff is http://paste.openstack.org/show/628742/

All policies with "@" have been dropped.
Dropped policies used in horizon are:
  os_compute_api:os-certificates:create
  os_compute_api:os-scheduler-hints:discoverable
  os_compute_api:os-server-groups:discoverable

[discoverable]
"discoverable" policies are related to nova API extensions
but the API extension mechanism has gone in Nova Queens,
so these policies now make no sense in Nova.
In Horizon side, we are still use a bit older API version
to launch instance, so it seems some fallback policies are needed
and they are added as conf/nova_policy.d.

[os_compute_api:os-certificates:create]
No corresponding policy is found, so the related policy check is dropped.
EC2 API is provided as a separate project from nova.
I guess this is the reason the policy was dropped.
DownloadEC2 action referred to it, but we already checks EC2 service
is available so I believe the policy can be dropped safely.

[openstack_dashboard.test.unit.api.rest.test_policy]
Unit tests are updated according to the nova policy change.
Note that test_rule_alone previously succeeded because it used
non-existing policy and fallbacked to 'default' rule.
The rule is changed to a policy for non-admin user.

Change-Id: I68f91bc29b20a4ecd613fc75735d38b9a48162ee

subject: Change default for sshd to only all keybased auth
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-01 15:55:30.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/PermitRootLogin-chages-7ce97df6d612223e.yaml'], 'message': 'Change default for sshd to only all keybased auth

Set PermitRootLogin to prohibit-password instead of yes.

Change-Id: Ifde08c43c29a6c437d622399ea48be96c0ac3432
'}]
commit_message:
Change default for sshd to only all keybased auth

Set PermitRootLogin to prohibit-password instead of yes.

commit_message:
Mock ipv6_utils.is_enabled_and_bind_by_default method

We test DHCP agent DeviceManager without mocking method
ipv6_utils.is_enabled_and_bind_by_default(). Because of that
it fails all the time on hosts without IPv6 support.
This patch adds mock to prevent those failures.

Change-Id: Icb4854892839a20619e92852c8b1a317d71231da
Closes-Bug: #1747437

We can simplify connection creation now. The Connection constructor
understands not to load yaml or env vars if it doesnt' receive a cloud
argument - so this can all be done in one step.

Update the mocks in the tests to work for the new calling pattern.

Finally - isoformat wasn't processing UTC+00:00. There are some
dark issues with how isoformats get passed around OpenStack, but this
fixes the unittest matching to account for UTC+00:00.
openstacksdk has been working on merging the code from shade and
os-client-config. Part of this will result in the removal of the
Profile object in favor of the CloudRegion object from the new
openstack.config.

This updates the Connection construction code to code that should work
with both old and new versions of openstacksdk.

Temporarily mask some jobs to get this in. Will need to revise the
tempest plugin to fix gate jobs later.

Related-Bug: #1681620
Co-Authored-By: tengqm <tengqim@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I10c74ca48b1ddb848a5a68cc4360431a21e0a2cc
"}]
commit_message:
Update sdk connection, tests and isoformat

We can simplify connection creation now. The Connection constructor
understands not to load yaml or env vars if it doesnt' receive a cloud
argument - so this can all be done in one step.

Update the mocks in the tests to work for the new calling pattern.

Finally - isoformat wasn't processing UTC+00:00. There are some
dark issues with how isoformats get passed around OpenStack, but this
fixes the unittest matching to account for UTC+00:00.
openstacksdk has been working on merging the code from shade and
os-client-config. Part of this will result in the removal of the
Profile object in favor of the CloudRegion object from the new
openstack.config.

This updates the Connection construction code to code that should work
with both old and new versions of openstacksdk.

Temporarily mask some jobs to get this in. Will need to revise the
tempest plugin to fix gate jobs later.

Related-Bug: #1681620
Co-Authored-By: tengqm <tengqim@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I10c74ca48b1ddb848a5a68cc4360431a21e0a2cc

subject: Fix breaking unit tests due to iso8601 changes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-02-06 17:47:27.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/timeutils.py', 'oslo_utils/tests/test_timeutils.py'], 'message': "Fix breaking unit tests due to iso8601 changes

The move from iso8601===0.1.11 to iso8601===0.1.12 broke unit
tests in oslo.utils.

iso8601 used to do:
    from datetime import datetime

But now they call datetime.datetime():
    import datetime
    datetime.datetime()

Unfortunately the unit tests that mocked datetime.datetime() are now
mocking the one in iso8601. This causes a failure in the unit tests.

Fix this by using the 'wraps' argument to mock. So that the calls will
get passed through to datetime.datetime. Also changed to using the
decorator style of mock.

In addition Python 3 unit tests were broken due to changing how the
UTC time zone is represented from 'UTC' to 'UTC+00:00'.

Closes-Bug: #1747575
Closes-Bug: #1744160
Change-Id: Ia80ffb5e571cc5366bef2bc1a32c457a3c16843d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix breaking unit tests due to iso8601 changes

The move from iso8601===0.1.11 to iso8601===0.1.12 broke unit
tests in oslo.utils.

iso8601 used to do:
    from datetime import datetime

But now they call datetime.datetime():
    import datetime
    datetime.datetime()

Unfortunately the unit tests that mocked datetime.datetime() are now
mocking the one in iso8601. This causes a failure in the unit tests.

Fix this by using the 'wraps' argument to mock. So that the calls will
get passed through to datetime.datetime. Also changed to using the
decorator style of mock.

In addition Python 3 unit tests were broken due to changing how the
UTC time zone is represented from 'UTC' to 'UTC+00:00'.

Closes-Bug: #1747575
Closes-Bug: #1744160
Change-Id: Ia80ffb5e571cc5366bef2bc1a32c457a3c16843d

commit_message:
zun: add hostname, hints and security_groups

Add three properties to the container resource: hostname,
hints and security_groups. The 'hostname' is the hostname of
the container. The 'hints' is a set of key-value pair passed
to the scheduler. The 'security_groups' is a list of neutron
security groups.

Change-Id: I518e37c9907350e364fa9a16b25013e68cc60fa9

Change-Id: I9cb7f1ef55ef5d82c9860720c52a1a48f05b2c7c

commit_message:
Improve Env Manager Interface

- Add to spec !config, !extras, !description fields as default values
- Allow to pass in EnvManager.create spec and optional parameters to replace
  config, extras and description
- Schema validation is now only in one place which is great
- Add config field to envs table (and change all corresponding places in db.api)
- Update all tests
- Add cached_data property which can be used when you don't need to refresh data
- Traceback & dates are now returened as string which allows to perform serialization operations
  (for all EnvManager commands)

Change-Id: I9cb7f1ef55ef5d82c9860720c52a1a48f05b2c7c

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-06 15:16:13.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/queens/oslo.privsep.yaml', 'deliverables/queens/oslo.serialization.yaml'], 'message': 'release oslo.serialization and oslo.privsep with updated msgpack dependency

The msgpack library has changed names, and we need to update the

release oslo.serialization and oslo.privsep with updated msgpack dependency

The msgpack library has changed names, and we need to update the
dependency so that downstream packagers can correctly package these
libraries and other OpenStack services.

Change-Id: Icb10952896d89ba6bfea083aea9e7872468e4ba7

commit_message:
Support traits in Glance

This blueprint proposes to extend the granular scheduling of compute
instances to be based on traits expressed in glance image metadata in
addition to the traits expressed by the flavor.

Blueprint: glance-image-traits

Change-Id: I9161f5491feac525d952dd71fb20b10de5db48f8

subject: Validate identity providers during token validation
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-02-01 23:35:02.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/provider.py', 'keystone/token/providers/common.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py', 'keystone/notifications.py', 'keystone/federation/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1291157-00b5c714a097e84c.yaml'], 'message': 'Validate identity providers during token validation

Previously, it was possible to validate a federated keystone token
after the identity provider associated by that token was deleted,
which is a security concern.

This commit does two things. First it makes it so that the token
cache is invalidated when identity providers are deleted. Second,
it validates the identity provider in the token data and ensures it
actually exists in the system before considering the token valid.

Change-Id: I57491c5a7d657b25cc436452acd7fcc4cd285839
Closes-Bug: 1291157
'}]
commit_message:
Validate identity providers during token validation

Previously, it was possible to validate a federated keystone token
after the identity provider associated by that token was deleted,
which is a security concern.

This commit does two things. First it makes it so that the token
cache is invalidated when identity providers are deleted. Second,
it validates the identity provider in the token data and ensures it
actually exists in the system before considering the token valid.

Change-Id: I57491c5a7d657b25cc436452acd7fcc4cd285839
Closes-Bug: 1291157

commit_message:
Finish refactoring self.*_api out of tests

A previous change started remove the self magic:

  Ic2094dca56158d8e4cd843eadff837f3a17ea38f

This commit finishes that work. A subsequent patch will remove the
self manager logic all together and we'll fix up any trivial test
infrastructure then.

Change-Id: Iedbde34ef5aa84905fd6b5f2297bf7f46dd7d278

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2018-02-06 12:54:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1735407.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_server_group.py', 'nova/objects/service.py', 'nova/tests/functional/integrated_helpers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'doc/source/user/cellsv2-layout.rst', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py'], 'message': 'Add late server group policy check to rebuild

The affinity and anti-affinity server group policy is enforced by the
scheduler but two parallel scheduling could cause that such policy is
violated. During instance boot a late policy check was performed in
the compute manager to prevent this. This check was missing in case
of rebuild. Therefore two parallel evacuate command could cause that
the server group policy is violated. This patch introduces the late
policy check to rebuild to prevent such situation. When the violation
is detected during boot a re-scheduling happens. However the rebuild
action does not have the re-scheduling implementation so in this case
the rebuild will fail and the evacuation needs to be retried by the
user. Still this is better than allowing a parallel evacuation to
break the server group affinity policy.

To make the late policy check possible in the compute/manager the
rebuild_instance compute RPC call was extended with a request_spec
parameter.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Zsarnoczai <richard.zsarnoczai@ericsson.com>

Change-Id: I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12
Closes-Bug: #1735407
'}]
commit_message:
Add late server group policy check to rebuild

The affinity and anti-affinity server group policy is enforced by the
scheduler but two parallel scheduling could cause that such policy is
violated. During instance boot a late policy check was performed in
the compute manager to prevent this. This check was missing in case
of rebuild. Therefore two parallel evacuate command could cause that
the server group policy is violated. This patch introduces the late
policy check to rebuild to prevent such situation. When the violation
is detected during boot a re-scheduling happens. However the rebuild
action does not have the re-scheduling implementation so in this case
the rebuild will fail and the evacuation needs to be retried by the
user. Still this is better than allowing a parallel evacuation to
break the server group affinity policy.

To make the late policy check possible in the compute/manager the
rebuild_instance compute RPC call was extended with a request_spec
parameter.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Zsarnoczai <richard.zsarnoczai@ericsson.com>

Change-Id: I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12
Closes-Bug: #1735407

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-02-03 15:56:11.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-keystone-install/tasks/install.yml'], 'message': 'Fix non-venv keystone handling

Turns out we were not installing two items that are
regardless of being in a venv, however we were installing
only when a venv was defined, and as a result the job
was failing in certian ci test cases since keystone
has not been previously required to be used by any
job.

Change-Id: I27358add99ab40c988627f2362e0f07c2324c670
'}]
commit_message:
Fix non-venv keystone handling

Turns out we were not installing two items that are
regardless of being in a venv, however we were installing
only when a venv was defined, and as a result the job
was failing in certian ci test cases since keystone
has not been previously required to be used by any
job.

Change-Id: I27358add99ab40c988627f2362e0f07c2324c670

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Fix upper-constraints use

Upper contrains use has been lacking on some of the
module installs, resulting in occassional issues
being encountered.

Apply the upper constraints file to our pip install
usage.

Change-Id: I877650a094be442218e5f7310037cfb9a523791f
Closes-Bug: #1675808

commit_message:
Add regression test for bug 1735407

Parallel evacuation can violate server group policy. This patch adds
functional test to recreate the bug.

The _wait_for_migration_status helper needed to be moved upper in the
test calls hierarchy so it can be reused for this test too.

Change-Id: I5bc50f9c0913a5b02c42f4ab201e9bf097395b54
Related-Bug: #1735407

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-02 15:10:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/manage.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "Remove instance.keypairs migration code

This was all added in Newton to prepare for moving
keypairs to the API database. The 345 nova DB migration
in Ocata forced people to run the online data migrations
to move keypairs out of the nova (cell) database to the
nova_api database. When they ran those data migrations,
they'd also be migrating instance.keypairs into the
instance_extra table.

At this point we can remove all of this migration code.

Change-Id: Ie83e7bd807c2c79e5cbe1337292c2d1989d4ac03
"}]
commit_message:
Remove instance.keypairs migration code

This was all added in Newton to prepare for moving
keypairs to the API database. The 345 nova DB migration
in Ocata forced people to run the online data migrations
to move keypairs out of the nova (cell) database to the
nova_api database. When they ran those data migrations,
they'd also be migrating instance.keypairs into the
instance_extra table.

At this point we can remove all of this migration code.

Change-Id: Ie83e7bd807c2c79e5cbe1337292c2d1989d4ac03

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-02 20:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/volume.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': "libvirt: fix native luks encryption failure to find volume_id

utility method to look up the volume_id in the connection_info
data dict and if not found there, uses the 'serial' value
from the connection_info, which we know at least gets set
when the DriverVolumeBlockDevice code attaches the volume.

This also has to update pre_live_migration since the connection_info
dict doesn't have a 'volume_id' key in it. It's unclear what
this code was expecting, or if it ever really worked, but since
an attached volume represented by a BlockDeviceMapping here has
a volume_id attribute, we can just use that. As that code path
was never tested, this updates related unit tests and refactors
the tests to actually use the type of DriverVolumeBlockDevice
objects that the ComputeManager would be sending down to the
driver pre_live_migration method. The hard-to-read squashed
dicts in the tests are also re-formatted so a human can actually
read them.

Change-Id: Ie02d298cd92d5b5ebcbbcd2b0e8be01f197bfafb
Closes-Bug: #1746609
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: fix native luks encryption failure to find volume_id

Not all volume types put a 'volume_id' entry in the
connection_info['data'] dict. This change uses a new
utility method to look up the volume_id in the connection_info
data dict and if not found there, uses the 'serial' value
from the connection_info, which we know at least gets set
when the DriverVolumeBlockDevice code attaches the volume.

This also has to update pre_live_migration since the connection_info
dict doesn't have a 'volume_id' key in it. It's unclear what
this code was expecting, or if it ever really worked, but since
an attached volume represented by a BlockDeviceMapping here has
a volume_id attribute, we can just use that. As that code path
was never tested, this updates related unit tests and refactors
the tests to actually use the type of DriverVolumeBlockDevice
objects that the ComputeManager would be sending down to the
driver pre_live_migration method. The hard-to-read squashed
dicts in the tests are also re-formatted so a human can actually
read them.

Change-Id: Ie02d298cd92d5b5ebcbbcd2b0e8be01f197bfafb
Closes-Bug: #1746609

commit_message:
Collect logs to a subfolder properly

The backport of https://review.openstack.org/522794
was incomplete, resulting in the logs still being
put in the same folder as the zuul logs, mixing
everything up and overwriting the ARA report.

This patch completes the backport properly.

subject: Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-24 04:16:45.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/timeutils.py'], 'message': 'Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct date
handling, but when converting this value there is a slight difference
where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC", but on python 3
they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match on
"UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Change-Id: Ia5e341f8ca751a9569ab9735a64509d6cfce44b2
Closes-bug: #1744160
'}]
commit_message:
Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct date
handling, but when converting this value there is a slight difference
where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC", but on python 3
they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match on
"UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Change-Id: Ia5e341f8ca751a9569ab9735a64509d6cfce44b2
Closes-bug: #1744160

subject: Ensure neutron agents & rabbitmq do not restart when upgrading
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-06 17:13:07.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/user/manual-upgrade.rst', 'scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Ensure neutron agents & rabbitmq do not restart when upgrading

This change adds neutron_agent and rabbitmq_all groups to the upgrade
process to ensure new container config does not cause these two
container types to restart.

> While the neutron_agents services have been moved on-to baremetal,
  the old container types will still exist and will have an active
  workload on them. Ensureing we guard against container restarts
  for these services will help deployers maximize uptime during the P>Q
  upgrade.

Change-Id: Ia9cfd8693af3ff2077638dd3c3935b9fec48a4c2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure neutron agents & rabbitmq do not restart when upgrading

This change adds neutron_agent and rabbitmq_all groups to the upgrade
process to ensure new container config does not cause these two
container types to restart.

> While the neutron_agents services have been moved on-to baremetal,
  the old container types will still exist and will have an active
  workload on them. Ensureing we guard against container restarts
  for these services will help deployers maximize uptime during the P>Q
  upgrade.

Change-Id: Ia9cfd8693af3ff2077638dd3c3935b9fec48a4c2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Lowering the number of ansible forks to 25

With forks set to 50, we can see upwards of 20GB RSS memory used on the
undercloud (depdning on the size of the overcloud). To reduce this, and
the chance for Ansible to run out of memory, I am recommending to update
this to 25.

To see the impact of forks set to 25:
https://snapshot.raintank.io/dashboard/snapshot/gseMLc1opbSueaY91tcjjbH9Lub2tnBm?orgId=2

Change-Id: I7c57b641aa7fea02f865778321c98d1dd3d7e085
Closes-Bug: 1740880
(cherry picked from commit I7c57b641aa7fea02f865778321c98d1dd3d7e085)

commit_message:
Remove use of CooldownMixin with scaling policy

Removes the multiple use of the mixin, so that we don't
set metadata for both policy and group. Setting the cooldown
metadata only for group would suffice.

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: I610527a56f13662ed6f10ae429d670f864582b33

dashboard configuration in review:

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-05 22:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/database/mongodb.pp'], 'message': 'mongodb: avoid duplicated resources in systemd config

The unit directory for mongodb service in systemd is already managed by
puppet-systemd. This patch will ensure that puppet-tripleo doesn't
manage the resource anymore and actually rely on it for orchestration
with a "require" statement.

Change-Id: Id030896250117dcc0eb6c4f5a7b8d8aa4d265fa5
Closes-Bug: #1747533
'}]
commit_message:
mongodb: avoid duplicated resources in systemd config

The unit directory for mongodb service in systemd is already managed by
puppet-systemd. This patch will ensure that puppet-tripleo doesn't
manage the resource anymore and actually rely on it for orchestration
with a "require" statement.

Change-Id: Id030896250117dcc0eb6c4f5a7b8d8aa4d265fa5
Closes-Bug: #1747533

commit_message:
roles: bifrost-ironic-install: Download the iPXE loader file

We are chaining to the PXE loader file instead of loading it as a kernel
image so we should download the ipxe.pxe file instead of the ipxe.lkrn
one

Fixes: I1f07e91ab109d1e59a377f1561a42fa9c0129405
Change-Id: Ica768cf304db9ed6abdb98976dceee5f04f3eac2

Add support for multiple inspection subnets

Configure Inspector with the required tags and
per-subnet dhcp router options to enable
inspection of nodes reaching the undercloud via
DHCP-relay on remote networks.

commit_message:
Update config to use per network groups

Use groups to specify control plane network data. When
we do routed networks we need to provide network data
for each controlplane network/subnet.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-ironic-inspector
Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment
Change-Id: Ia95ff5c00433c89155727ea5551904c45197e6b0

subject: Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-24 21:54:20.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf

The problem we have with redis can be described as follows:
- Connection is made to redis via haproxy, where haproxy directs to one redis node
- That chosen redis node fails and a new redis node gets promoted
- HAProxy will send *new* connections to redis to the newly promoted
  redis server, but you still have a session active (ie. that has not hit
  timeout), so haproxy will attempt to use that connection.

By using 'on-marked-down shutdown-sessions' we make sure we close
old existing sessions when the redis master node changes.

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to some context differences

Closes-Bug: #1742086
Tested-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9
(cherry picked from commit dbfc8e1c1d5f39c7e64de7d7188cb2325492ee2a)
(cherry picked from commit 3eebb0b00b06dd8f57d8f17d5b822d7346b6d2f2)
(cherry picked from commit 507fd3a69fbe85ff3c1eac45ad1b88cc70769157)
"}]
commit_message:
Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf

The problem we have with redis can be described as follows:
- Connection is made to redis via haproxy, where haproxy directs to one redis node
- That chosen redis node fails and a new redis node gets promoted
- HAProxy will send *new* connections to redis to the newly promoted
  redis server, but you still have a session active (ie. that has not hit
  timeout), so haproxy will attempt to use that connection.

By using 'on-marked-down shutdown-sessions' we make sure we close
old existing sessions when the redis master node changes.

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to some context differences

Closes-Bug: #1742086
Tested-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9
(cherry picked from commit dbfc8e1c1d5f39c7e64de7d7188cb2325492ee2a)
(cherry picked from commit 3eebb0b00b06dd8f57d8f17d5b822d7346b6d2f2)
(cherry picked from commit 507fd3a69fbe85ff3c1eac45ad1b88cc70769157)

commit_message:
Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf

The problem we have with redis can be described as follows:
- Connection is made to redis via haproxy, where haproxy directs to one redis node
- That chosen redis node fails and a new redis node gets promoted
- HAProxy will send *new* connections to redis to the newly promoted
  redis server, but you still have a session active (ie. that has not hit
  timeout), so haproxy will attempt to use that connection.

By using 'on-marked-down shutdown-sessions' we make sure we close
old existing sessions when the redis master node changes.

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to some context differences

Closes-Bug: #1742086
Tested-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9

tests: test-cinder-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

commit_message:
Provide additional flexibility for the calico chart

* Ingests the bird templates so that we can override them
to support things such as custom BGP ports (listen) and
neighbors (remote)

* Supports announcing addresses that are within the
.Values.networking.bgp.ipv4|6.additional_cidrs list
in support of ingress controllers that can create
dummy interfaces and assign addresses to be announced

* Introduces a new job to perform calicoctl manipulation to
support manipulating the mesh, adding peers, and changing the
ipPool settings which is value driven

* Support custom port binding and specific interface binding
to allow custom BGP port selection for IPv4 and IPv6

* Instantiates calicoctl as a utility on hosts

* Adds a new function to helm-toolkit to retrieve the http
or https prefix for an endpoint

* Supports https based etcd backends with new certificate
parameters

* Finally, introduces more strict bgp listening to allow
multiple hostNet bgp speakers to run in parallel

Change-Id: Ib4d00befddbd8498b9dcc693409b8b2577458497

commit_message:
Add the nova-multiattach job

This change adds a new voting check/gate queue job for running
volume multiattach compute API tests.

This configures devstack to enable tempest for volume multiattach
support and disables the Pike UCA since we need qemu<2.10 for
libvirt to work with multiattach volumes.

Depends on the following devstack patch to add the
ENABLE_VOLUME_MULTIATTACH variable. The devstack patch
depends on the tempest patch that adds the volume multiattach
tests and the tempest patch depends on the series of nova
changes that add volume multiattach support.

Depends-On: I46b7eabf6a28f230666f6933a087f73cb4408348

Depends on the following nova patch to fix a bug when
creating a server snapshot of a paused instance when not
using the Pike UCA:

Depends-On: If6c4dd6890ad6e2d00b186c6a9aa85f507b354e0

Depends on the tip of the series of Tempest tests which include
additional tests for resize with a multiattach volume and swap
volume with a multiattach volume.

Depends-On: I751e9e4237e2997e102dd13c4f060deaea73d543

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: I51adbbdf13711e463b4d25c2ffd4a3123cd65675

commit_message:
Fix deployment_with_ha missing attribute

Currently the 'create ffu overcloud upgrade scripts' task fails with
'bool object' has no attribute 'rc'. This change fixes this issue by
using the correct conditional when creating the script file.

Change-Id: I70b41ab9121599302ad9590e7ae92dbe96d03310

subject: cinder incremental backup with ceph fails if last one deleted
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15670, 'name': 'StorPool OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@storpool.com', 'username': 'storpoolci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15831, 'name': 'Infortrend CI', 'email': 'ryan.chiang@infortrend.com', 'username': 'InfortrendCI'}, {'_account_id': 21863, 'name': 'Infinidat CI', 'email': 'jenkins@infinidat.com', 'username': 'infinidat-openstack'}, {'_account_id': 21976, 'name': 'Kaminario K2 CI', 'email': 'cinder.devops.CTR@kaminario.com', 'username': 'kaminario'}, {'_account_id': 22126, 'name': 'Huawei FusionStorage CI', 'email': '294958976@qq.com', 'username': 'hustnw', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22510, 'name': 'Synology DSM CI', 'email': 'cinder@synology.com', 'username': 'synocinder', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23613, 'name': 'NEC Cinder CI', 'email': 'nec-cinder-ci@istorage.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'nec-cinder-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24230, 'name': 'NetApp E-Series CI', 'email': 'ng-openstack-eseries-ci@netapp.com', 'username': 'netapp-eseries-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25243, 'name': 'NetApp CI', 'username': 'NetApp-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26537, 'name': 'Cloudbase Cinder SMB3 CI', 'email': 'cinder-smb3-ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'cinder_smb3_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-26 16:30:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_ceph.py', 'cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py'], 'message': 'cinder incremental backup with ceph fails if last one deleted

If the last incremental backup is deleted then the backup snapshot
is deleted but the source volume snapshot remains. Due to mismatch
between the source volume snapshot and backup snapshot, there is an
error when "rbd export-diff" and "rbd import-diff" is done. Hence,
full backup happens.

To fix this issue, all the previous source volume snapshots are
preserved. When the last incremental backup is deleted, then its
backup snapshot is deleted. But because all the source volume snaps
exist, thus it can now update --from-snap for "rbd export-diff" to
be the most recent source volume snapshot for which there exists a
backup snapshot as well. This is how the incremental backup operation
will go successful.

For a user who upgrades to the new code, if the last backup snapshot
and source volume snapshot are in sync, i.e. both of them exist, then
the next create backup operation will continue as an incremental one.
However, if there is no source volume snapshot for the last existing
incremental backup (before the code was upgraded), then a full backup
happens. After this full backup, all the next backups are incremental
while all their corresponding source volume snapshots are also preserved.
In this way, after a user upgrades, if he deletes the last incremental
backup, the next create backup operation will be successful and be
incremental.

Since all the backup snapshots exist for all the backups, if the user
wants to restore a backup, which was created before the code was upgraded,
the user will not lose any data since the same base backup is used.

Change-Id: Ia9c29bb720152d42bec273202fa49ca4b6a41ce2
Closes-Bug: #1703011
(cherry picked from commit bc9ab142da919087c71525978f960115ff0259b9)
'}]
commit_message:
cinder incremental backup with ceph fails if last one deleted

If the last incremental backup is deleted then the backup snapshot
is deleted but the source volume snapshot remains. Due to mismatch
between the source volume snapshot and backup snapshot, there is an
error when "rbd export-diff" and "rbd import-diff" is done. Hence,
full backup happens.

To fix this issue, all the previous source volume snapshots are
preserved. When the last incremental backup is deleted, then its
backup snapshot is deleted. But because all the source volume snaps
exist, thus it can now update --from-snap for "rbd export-diff" to
be the most recent source volume snapshot for which there exists a
backup snapshot as well. This is how the incremental backup operation
will go successful.

For a user who upgrades to the new code, if the last backup snapshot
and source volume snapshot are in sync, i.e. both of them exist, then
the next create backup operation will continue as an incremental one.
However, if there is no source volume snapshot for the last existing
incremental backup (before the code was upgraded), then a full backup
happens. After this full backup, all the next backups are incremental
while all their corresponding source volume snapshots are also preserved.
In this way, after a user upgrades, if he deletes the last incremental
backup, the next create backup operation will be successful and be
incremental.

Since all the backup snapshots exist for all the backups, if the user
wants to restore a backup, which was created before the code was upgraded,
the user will not lose any data since the same base backup is used.

Change-Id: Ia9c29bb720152d42bec273202fa49ca4b6a41ce2
Closes-Bug: #1703011
(cherry picked from commit bc9ab142da919087c71525978f960115ff0259b9)

commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants

There are several places in the source code where HTTP response
codes are used as numeric values.

Status codes 200, 201, 202, 204, 300, 400, 401, 403, 404, 408, 409, 422
and 424 under volume/drivers are replaced with symbolic constants from
six.moves.http_client thus improves code readability.

Closes-Bug: #1520159
Change-Id: I6d0721588af1491139e0dee8d84e21638ec7febb

constants from six.moves.http_client thus improves code readability.
More patches will be submitted to address other status codes.

Partial-Bug: #1520159
Change-Id: I7fd0f1b5a1e15d718e407def2334ff7aea52c071
'}]
commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants

There are several places in the drivers(dell_emc,hpe) where HTTP
response codes are used as numeric values.

Status codes 200, 400, 401, 403, 404, 409 and 500 under
tests/unit/volume/drivers(dell_emc,hpe) are replaced with symbolic
constants from six.moves.http_client thus improves code readability.
More patches will be submitted to address other status codes.

Partial-Bug: #1520159
Change-Id: I7fd0f1b5a1e15d718e407def2334ff7aea52c071

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/quest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-06 19:54:19.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/quest

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I534f80cd7503971a12712d0b1142bb0badce6fe3
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/quest

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I534f80cd7503971a12712d0b1142bb0badce6fe3

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-07 11:14:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fix the count error of chunked based volume backup

this bug is that the initial value of object_id is 1, and
the last addition was not used.so we change the initial
value of object_id is 0 and add addition before it be used to
make object_name start with object1

Change-Id: I08eecd77998c9b949238cdd9a686eae57d5dd683
Closes-Bug: #1701177
'}]
commit_message:
fix the count error of chunked based volume backup

this bug is that the initial value of object_id is 1, and
the last addition was not used.so we change the initial
value of object_id is 0 and add addition before it be used to
make object_name start with object1

Change-Id: I08eecd77998c9b949238cdd9a686eae57d5dd683
Closes-Bug: #1701177

revisions:

Since ironic change I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792, the
sample policy.json is not present in the ironic repository. Since policy
is now in code, it is not required.

This change removes support for copying the sample policy file to
/etc/ironic.

Change-Id: Id0e8eb54b0d67ba1c522c6e76afad2b61059a621
"}]
commit_message:
Don't copy ironic's policy.json sample

Since ironic change I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792, the
sample policy.json is not present in the ironic repository. Since policy
is now in code, it is not required.

This change removes support for copying the sample policy file to
/etc/ironic.

Change-Id: Id0e8eb54b0d67ba1c522c6e76afad2b61059a621

commit_message:
EDP doc: de-emphasize job binary internals (not in v2)

* Adding deprecation warning about job binary internals in the
  dashboard user guide
* Changing how deprecation warning is given at userdoc edp page
* Changing dashboard user guid job examples, now it uses swift
  as type storage for job binaries instead of internals

Change-Id: Ib1083ee6f6e204248e10f17b5ce58fd424e74106
Partial-Implements: bp remove-job-binary-internal

When executing backup create API, output does not
contain any status of backup being created.

But as backup create operation is asynchronous operation,
it must show status as creating etc.

This patchset will fix this issue.

APIImpact one more response parameter status added

Closes-Bug:#1567342

Change-Id: Ied10979a29361471746ba37bea68f8ca16c7269d
'}]
commit_message:
Backup create does not return status

When executing backup create API, output does not
contain any status of backup being created.

But as backup create operation is asynchronous operation,
it must show status as creating etc.

This patchset will fix this issue.

APIImpact one more response parameter status added

Closes-Bug:#1567342

Change-Id: Ied10979a29361471746ba37bea68f8ca16c7269d

The accept_transfer API is now able to use volume versioned objects.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot notation everywhere

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects
'}]
commit_message:
Update accept_transfer to use volume object

The accept_transfer API is now able to use volume versioned objects.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot notation everywhere
to keep the size small. This cleanup will be done in the future.

Change-Id: I593f7117101f37db449676235dabdc6494d8bfc3
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-30 06:33:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Update logic when creating volume from source

Currently when creating a volume from source volume or snapshot,
it checks whether backend name of source volume type and target volume
type are same in extra_specs. If same, it allows to create a new volume
from the source volume.

But sometimes there is no backend setting in volume types. The fix is
to allow such case: volume type A has backend setting, there is a volume
in volume type. Volume type B has no backend setting. And users are
going to create a new volume with type B from above volume. In this
scenario, Cinder should allow to create.

In this fix, it checks whether source.host can be suitable
to target volume type.

Change-Id: I5c2b5926f4c20e024fb3e8d836ffa020ae4b0cf1
Closes-bug: #1572413
'}]
commit_message:
Update logic when creating volume from source

Currently when creating a volume from source volume or snapshot,
it checks whether backend name of source volume type and target volume
type are same in extra_specs. If same, it allows to create a new volume
from the source volume.

But sometimes there is no backend setting in volume types. The fix is
to allow such case: volume type A has backend setting, there is a volume
in volume type. Volume type B has no backend setting. And users are
going to create a new volume with type B from above volume. In this
scenario, Cinder should allow to create.

In this fix, it checks whether source.host can be suitable
to target volume type.

Change-Id: I5c2b5926f4c20e024fb3e8d836ffa020ae4b0cf1
Closes-bug: #1572413

commit_message:
Generate support matrix using driver interfaces

Using the ABC classes in cinder.interfaces inspect each driver to
determine what features are implemented and generate a table matrix
using sphinx that users\operators can reference.

Change-Id: If4f7be551e46e7804bf3c99af635c2dd723e5f4f
Co-Authored-By: Karthik Prabhu <karthik.prabhu.vinod@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add snapshots/summary API support

Add a new API to display snapshots summary with total number of snapshots
and total size in GB (total_size: 500 and total_count: 20).

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint display-volumes-summary-details

Change-Id: I39065488fc39c24d47f84d2848993e86e7e3a3aa
Co-Authored-By: MR Swami Reddy <swamireddy@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I4c652a85eefa808db7d5e47dcc05ca3bb04388c5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-01 23:18:49.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/formatters/yaml.py', 'tests/unit/formatters/test_yaml.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-url-in-yaml-0bfdcc93f5b6d118.yaml'], 'message': 'Add more_info URL to the YAML output

Currently, outputting bandit findings as YAML does not put the
``more_info`` URL in the output as it would if the output format
is HTML or JSON.  This patch set updates the YAML formatter to
include the ``more_info`` URL to be inline with the HTML and JSON
formatters.

Change-Id: Ice134e3bbf67c59feb7a88b299e60838b6ad80d5
Closes-Bug: #1746827
'}]
commit_message:
Add more_info URL to the YAML output

Currently, outputting bandit findings as YAML does not put the
``more_info`` URL in the output as it would if the output format
is HTML or JSON.  This patch set updates the YAML formatter to
include the ``more_info`` URL to be inline with the HTML and JSON
formatters.

Change-Id: Ice134e3bbf67c59feb7a88b299e60838b6ad80d5
Closes-Bug: #1746827

commit_message:
Trim the fat from InstanceInfo

Nova removed several fields from InstanceInfo that were not being
used [1]. This copies our corresponding in-tree driver changes to
the out-of-tree driver.

[1] 5db9389c01b0cb6eeacf57c22550876ffcd1a87c

Closes-Bug: #1695924
Change-Id: I865d9177329294f555dfda14f2ffd85bd022db56

This allows Nova to work with the previous version of Ironic. It
attempts to make a single call to the Ironic API at the current
microversion. If that fails, then it falls back to the previous and

commit_message:
Ironic: negotiate microversion to allow downgrade to Pike

This allows Nova to work with the previous version of Ironic. It
attempts to make a single call to the Ironic API at the current
microversion. If that fails, then it falls back to the previous and
assumes it will work. It also only allows passing a configdrive on
rebuild if the latest microversion is supported.

Partial-Bug: #1739440
Change-Id: Id89e37e939b3ed43fb10bc6b4fa23dcbe172fb8d

commit_message:
Add release-type directives for pike

Some projects have updated their release-type for horizon
plugins in queens, but a similar change has not been done
in pike. Rather than waiting for their first stable release
request to fail, adding these changes to those deliverables
to account for these changes.

Change-Id: Ifd51d3dd1d04b1bb11d311fc46f6faf642d432c4

subject: Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-02 17:01:01.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting

LXD 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container)
and this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.
Unfortunately, pylxd 2.2.2 can't handle this extra attribute and
crashes out. This was fixed in pylxd 2.2.4, but has not been ported
to the 2.0.x series.

As such, we switch the test job to non-voting until an upstream
fix is available.

Change-Id: Ia4f1351095023cb90d6491f4dbacaf0288f728c1
Related-Source-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-pylxd/+bug/1736454
Related-Bug: #1746068
"}]
commit_message:
Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting

LXD 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container)
and this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.
Unfortunately, pylxd 2.2.2 can't handle this extra attribute and
crashes out. This was fixed in pylxd 2.2.4, but has not been ported
to the 2.0.x series.

As such, we switch the test job to non-voting until an upstream
fix is available.

Change-Id: Ia4f1351095023cb90d6491f4dbacaf0288f728c1
Related-Source-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-pylxd/+bug/1736454
Related-Bug: #1746068

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-23 11:20:31.000000000', 'files': ['roles/overcloud-upgrade/templates/upgrade-repo-tripleo-ci.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Use repos variable for the upgrade jobs.

In mixed version setup the repos on the undercloud are set to the
target version tested.  During the upgrade to pike for instance the
repo setup command for the undercloud will be empty as the target
version is not “master” but pike.  This can prevent us to get the
latest packages.

Furthermore it simplify the setup as the target repo are configured in
only one place.

Eventually it will make it matches what is configured for the
overcloud in “overcloud-repo.yaml”.

Change-Id: I7f8a3c226e9b28c9569f771233c5331bd808751c
'}]
commit_message:
Use repos variable for the upgrade jobs.

In mixed version setup the repos on the undercloud are set to the
target version tested.  During the upgrade to pike for instance the
repo setup command for the undercloud will be empty as the target
version is not “master” but pike.  This can prevent us to get the
latest packages.

Furthermore it simplify the setup as the target repo are configured in
only one place.

Eventually it will make it matches what is configured for the
overcloud in “overcloud-repo.yaml”.

Change-Id: I7f8a3c226e9b28c9569f771233c5331bd808751c

commit_message:
Disable citycloud in nodepool

At the request of Daniel Öhberg, CityNetwork VP of Operations, we
are ceasing booting CI nodes in any remaining regions and pausing
all image uploads for now. We should get back in touch with them
around the beginning of July to find out whether they're ready for
us to reenable use of this account.

Change-Id: I39f12d5a8441b197f5a310c7b33ba42c04c73378

commit_message:
Sort the complete plugin list

Currently the plugin listing found at the link below [1] is unsorted
by bandit ID number, yet the IDs are listed, making it confusing
to look at.

This patch sorts the plugin list by renaming each plugin filename
so that sphinx sorts accordingly.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/bandit/latest/plugins/index.html#complete-test-plugin-listing

Change-Id: Ib16b85d1025dd667f711e8571dd58a59deb74d29

subject: Don't install etcd on a compute-only node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'message': "Don't install etcd on a compute-only node

This is associated with current (and not yet fully reliable)
observations that etcd proxy does not work for reading v3 data.  Hence,
instead of using a local proxy, we should configure Calico everywhere to
speak directly to the etcd server.

Change-Id: Ifdb7214de4632a708c9db2f3a23877ea37dbecbc
"}]
commit_message:
Don't install etcd on a compute-only node

This is associated with current (and not yet fully reliable)
observations that etcd proxy does not work for reading v3 data.  Hence,
instead of using a local proxy, we should configure Calico everywhere to
speak directly to the etcd server.

Change-Id: Ifdb7214de4632a708c9db2f3a23877ea37dbecbc

subject: Capture Felix logging in OpenStack CI runs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Capture Felix logging in OpenStack CI runs

The OpenStack CI process (devstack-gate) saves off all logs generated by
systemd services that are started with "run_process", but not _all_
services, and so not calico-felix.  But to get the logging from
calico-felix we can use "run_process" to start a secondary service that
just tails Felix's log.  That's what we do here, and the Felix log is
then available in captured logs as a file named
screen-felix-logger.txt.gz.

Change-Id: I40957a3ed4f96a68272a50bcc40303dde770553f
'}]
commit_message:
Capture Felix logging in OpenStack CI runs

The OpenStack CI process (devstack-gate) saves off all logs generated by
systemd services that are started with "run_process", but not _all_
services, and so not calico-felix.  But to get the logging from
calico-felix we can use "run_process" to start a secondary service that
just tails Felix's log.  That's what we do here, and the Felix log is
then available in captured logs as a file named
screen-felix-logger.txt.gz.

Change-Id: I40957a3ed4f96a68272a50bcc40303dde770553f

subject: Build WorkloadEndpoint name as libcalico-go requires
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/mech_calico.py'], 'message': "Build WorkloadEndpoint name as libcalico-go requires

libcalico-go needs the name to conform to the pattern
<host>-<orchestrator>-<workload>-<endpoint> (so that it can map to the
v1 WorkloadEndpointKey without reference to the v3 spec).

(Also Felix needs at least some of those pieces to be correct.  I think
probably <host> and <endpoint>, but haven't fully checked.  So we may as
well make them all exactly match the corresponding spec fields.)

Change-Id: Ife4010d0955529364f96ec1941737b0fd255898a
"}]
commit_message:
Build WorkloadEndpoint name as libcalico-go requires

libcalico-go needs the name to conform to the pattern
<host>-<orchestrator>-<workload>-<endpoint> (so that it can map to the
v1 WorkloadEndpointKey without reference to the v3 spec).

(Also Felix needs at least some of those pieces to be correct.  I think
probably <host> and <endpoint>, but haven't fully checked.  So we may as
well make them all exactly match the corresponding spec fields.)

Change-Id: Ife4010d0955529364f96ec1941737b0fd255898a

subject: Use monotonic_time() for StatusWatcher inactivity logic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/t_etcd.py'], 'message': 'Use monotonic_time() for StatusWatcher inactivity logic

I thought time.gmtime() returned a monotonic number of seconds from some
epoch, but in fact it returns a tuple.  monotonic_time() is what we want
here.

Change-Id: Iaaafc0d3b06683829d91d40da3f179b61a9f6d54
'}]
commit_message:
Use monotonic_time() for StatusWatcher inactivity logic

I thought time.gmtime() returned a monotonic number of seconds from some
epoch, but in fact it returns a tuple.  monotonic_time() is what we want
here.

Change-Id: Iaaafc0d3b06683829d91d40da3f179b61a9f6d54

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Tell Calico how to access the etcd server

Specifically, 127.0.0.1 doesn't work because the devstack-installed etcd

Change-Id: I0586bf774b59af9ad94e45293506311e4818ef66
"}]
commit_message:
Tell Calico how to access the etcd server

Specifically, 127.0.0.1 doesn't work because the devstack-installed etcd
does not listen on that; we need a real IP address.

Change-Id: I0586bf774b59af9ad94e45293506311e4818ef66

commit_message:
Endpoint handling -> v3 as well as v1

Note that we keep the v1 handling as well, for communication with the
DHCP agent, so as to avoid having to update the DHCP agent code as
well (at least for now).

Change-Id: Ibad03b769342aa9deb1ac0f386957a3158662a6d

revisions:

commit_message:
Use DevStack etcd install instead of our own

Because there isn't yet a package for etcdv3 in Ubuntu, and our own
install code is package-based and so gives us etcdv2.

Change-Id: Iab145521e73413dd910148693cf8a619764ffe1a

commit_message:
Ironic conductor works correctly on changes of networks

Now ,if provisioning/cleaning network is changed, Ironic conductor
behave correctly. Removed the conductor caching of provisioning/
cleaning network uuid. Now ironic conductor will pick up the
details each and  every time.

Change-Id: I38e563531832a524880b0484d755a71642896689
Closes-Bug: #1679260

commit_message:
mongodb: avoid duplicated resources in systemd config

The unit directory for mongodb service in systemd is already managed by
puppet-systemd. This patch will ensure that puppet-tripleo doesn't
manage the resource anymore and actually rely on it for orchestration
with a "require" statement.

Change-Id: Id030896250117dcc0eb6c4f5a7b8d8aa4d265fa5
Closes-Bug: #1747533
(cherry picked from commit 961a6fd0d4963853d1ee25e6faeed10fbf16f730)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17656, 'name': 'blkart', 'email': 'blkart.org@gmail.com', 'username': 'blkart'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23498, 'name': 'IBM zVM CI', 'email': 'zvmosci@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'zvmosci'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-02 17:20:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4
"}]
commit_message:
Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4

subject: i18n: Annotate template generator django template properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-06 04:57:05.000000000', 'files': ['heat_dashboard/content/template_generator/templates/template_generator/index.html'], 'message': 'i18n: Annotate template generator django template properly

Strings in Django template for the template generator was previously
annotated using angular-gettext syntax, but this is Djnago temaplate.
Djnago templates need to be annotated in the Django i18n way [1].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/i18n/translation/#internationalization-in-template-code

Change-Id: I094fd3ab1c59bb1f96e713a70054cc5b99898974
Partial-Bug: #1747302
'}]
commit_message:
i18n: Annotate template generator django template properly

Strings in Django template for the template generator was previously
annotated using angular-gettext syntax, but this is Djnago temaplate.
Djnago templates need to be annotated in the Django i18n way [1].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/i18n/translation/#internationalization-in-template-code

Change-Id: I094fd3ab1c59bb1f96e713a70054cc5b99898974
Partial-Bug: #1747302

commit_message:
Generate HostnameMap with quickstart interface

... and not config-download.yaml.j2 in tripleo-quickstart-extras.
That way, we can get rid of HostnameMap in config-download.yaml.j2
which is only working with one subnode, and we can make it work for any
architecture thanks to the quickstart interface.

Change-Id: I21b151b6bba8f84afff441078b4762453c6a091c

commit_message:
Add N1Kv functionality to VM launch

As part of the core-vendor decomposition of horizon, cisco n1kv
specific code in VM launch would be removed from upstream
horizon. This patch adds that functionality back by extending
upstream classes related to VM launch with n1kv code.

It also adds back the unit tests related to launch instance
that will be removed with the main functionality from upstream
horizon.

Change-Id: Iadfc47683364193257cc210de28e7f98dd2e5a2c
Closes-Bug: 1492082

commit_message:
Remove _create_network override code

We need to remove following from overrides.py file

horizon_network_workflows.CreateNetwork._create_network = \
    cisco_network_workflows.DFACreateNetwork._create_network

Because of this line it tries to find _create_network function in
workflows.py but it won;t find it because we are using Parent's
_create_network function

Change-Id: I71cf399c82542e69eb5cfacba6642d81ed3ec353
Implements: Fixes Create Network Functionality
Closes-Bug: #1687489

* Made workflow execution creation idempotent. We can now

  execution object. If the object with this ID doesn't exist,

  and also the corresponding workflow gets started normally.
  If the object exists then the endpoint just returns
  properties of this object in JSON w/o starting the workflow.
  If an execution ID is not passed then the endpoint works as
  before, so it is backwards compatible with the previous
  version.

  depending on whether we passed an execution ID.
* Had to add "wf_ex_id" paramter to the "start_workflow"
  method of the Engine API and fix all relevant calls.

Implements blueprint: mistral-idempotent-execution-create

'}]
commit_message:
Make workflow execution creation idempotent

* Made workflow execution creation idempotent. We can now
  pass an execution ID which is used when creating a new
  execution object. If the object with this ID doesn't exist,
  then a new execution is created and this ID is assigned to,
  and also the corresponding workflow gets started normally.
  If the object exists then the endpoint just returns
  properties of this object in JSON w/o starting the workflow.
  If an execution ID is not passed then the endpoint works as
  before, so it is backwards compatible with the previous
  version.
* Added unit tests to check all possible logic branches
  depending on whether we passed an execution ID.
* Had to add "wf_ex_id" paramter to the "start_workflow"
  method of the Engine API and fix all relevant calls.
* Other minor style changes.

Implements blueprint: mistral-idempotent-execution-create

Change-Id: I1f650efbd23b00298a30e16893ca4f18d87c99b3

The argument of 'insecure_registry' for image push has been removed
by this commit (in docker 3.0.0):
https://github.com/docker/docker-py/commit/b180b8770a265e33099bd6da76c3e556a1028491

Actually this argument was marked as deprecated and unfunctional
before this removing.

This commit is to remove this parameter at invoking the push() function
when docker version >= 3.0.0.

Change-Id: Ifa7d304d08a4073dcb1dff751d5a443c112cd377
Closes-Bug: #1746703
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the unsupported 'insecure_registry' for >=docker 3.0.0

The argument of 'insecure_registry' for image push has been removed
by this commit (in docker 3.0.0):
https://github.com/docker/docker-py/commit/b180b8770a265e33099bd6da76c3e556a1028491

Actually this argument was marked as deprecated and unfunctional
before this removing.

This commit is to remove this parameter at invoking the push() function
when docker version >= 3.0.0.

Change-Id: Ifa7d304d08a4073dcb1dff751d5a443c112cd377
Closes-Bug: #1746703

Closes-Bug: #1747453
'}]
commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

The current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html" does not
match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I7414e9d973be98e5ee6d6277cf750ded40bc6c7a
Closes-Bug: #1747453

commit_message:
Only run map_instances for Ocata

map_instances only needs to be run during the transition from
Newton to Ocata to map existing instances into a cell. All
new Ocata instances will be automatically mapped to a call.
This change limits the slow running map_instances command to
just run for upgrades to Ocata

Change-Id: Ic2e2df530504284d28cfcab26a71d211342203fa
Closes-Bug: #1743357

commit_message:
Remove die-on-term in uwsgi config

This removes setting die-on-term in uwsgi config: it prevents the
services from stopping cleanly instead relying on the SIGKILL after a
timeout.

Change-Id: Ic4a404f5c6e51ae0fd3dd5ef9abfb7ff445d887b
Closes-Bug: #1724497

processManagement.fork must set be True, otherwise it starts failed.
